ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Absolutely. But the student should enjoy Greek history generally and be willing/able to devote significant time to the course -- the reading load isn't light. (a heavy workload, by the way, shouldn't be juxtaposed with an "appropriate" work load below. a heavy workload may well be quite appropriate, depending on the class. fix this, Yale)
It's great. Take it. ESPECIALLY if you've never studied ancient Greece before.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Well unfortunately apparently this course was 'too ancient' to count for my regional history requirement, so it wasn't particularly useful in fulfilling any requirements.But it was very useful in helping me glean a fuller understanding of international relations, empire, war and peace, and democracy.
